text: Make You Happy is a compilation album by Australian rock band Divinyls, which was released on October 21, 1997. It consists of material spanning from 1981 to 1993 including the hits "Boys in Town", "Science Fiction", "Pleasure and Pain" and their number-one signature song "I Touch Myself".Peak chart positions for charting releases in Australia: * Kent Music Report:– * ARIA Albums Chart:– * ARIA Singles Chart:– The album's name comes from "I'll Make You Happy", the B-side of "Science Fiction" and a cover version of the 1960s track by The Easybeats. Track 20, "Love in Motion", is a 1992 rerecording of Icehouse's 1981 single with Divinyls' Christina Amphlett featuring on co-lead vocals. Despite being released in 1997, this compilation did not include recordings from the band's 1996 album Underworld. ==Track listing== ==References== Category:1997 albums Category:Divinyls albums Category:Chrysalis Records compilation albums
title: Make You Happy (album)
